hero.title: History and Milestone Achievements of NARA
hero.headline: Pioneering Aquatic Stewardship in Sri Lanka
hero.description:
Since its inception, the National Aquatic Resources Research and Development Agency (NARA) has stood at the forefront of safeguarding and advancing Sri Lanka's priceless aquatic wealth. As the nation's premier institute for marine and freshwater science, NARA embodies a legacy of innovation, conservation, and sustainable development. From responding to newly expanded maritime boundaries to forging global collaborations today, our journey reflects a commitment to science-driven solutions that uplift ecosystems, communities, and the Blue Economy.

As we celebrate over four decades of impact, we invite you to explore the milestones that define our enduring mission and the people who make it possible.

history.title: Our Founding and Evolution
history.intro: NARA was born from a visionary need to harness scientific expertise for Sri Lanka's vast oceanic frontier. In 1981, following the United Nations Conference on the Law of the Sea, Sri Lanka declared a 200-nautical-mile Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ)--an expansive 460,000 square kilometers of sea territory, nearly eight times the nation's land area.
body: To manage this bounty responsibly, NARA was established under Act No. 54 of 1981, transforming the Department of Fisheries Research Division into a dedicated statutory body. Governed by a Board of Governors and empowered to conduct research, advise policymakers, and coordinate national efforts, NARA quickly became the apex authority on aquatic resources spanning oceanography, fisheries enhancement, socio-economic studies, and conservation.

This foundational step marked the dawn of integrated aquatic management in Sri Lanka. Through legislative refinement and global partnerships we have evolved to meet climate realities, biodiversity challenges, and the demands of a thriving Blue Economy--always guided by science, resilience, and service.

timeline.title: Act No. 54 Establishes NARA
timeline.description: Officially constituted as Sri Lanka's principal institute for aquatic research, development, and management following the declaration of the 200 NM EEZ.

timeline.title: National Focal Point for IUCN
timeline.description: Advanced marine biodiversity conservation and international cooperation during a formative era of global environmental awareness.

timeline.title: Act No. 32 Empowers Expansion
timeline.description: Landmark amendment expanded advisory, training, and coordination roles across coastal, inland, and offshore domains.

timeline.title: Socio-Economics Division Launch
timeline.description: Established dedicated capacity to study fishing industry dynamics, market strategies, and community well-being.

timeline.title: Hydrographic Leadership
timeline.description: Hosted the 12th North Indian Ocean Hydrographic Commission, commissioned a new research vessel, and conducted special R&D surveys to enhance mapping accuracy.

timeline.title: Policy Advisory Recognition
timeline.description: Released comprehensive reports on EIA consultancies and resource management, solidifying NARA's role in national decision-making.

timeline.title: President's Awards for Research
timeline.description: Two NARA scientists honored by the National Research Council for fisheries oceanography and environmental publications; secured key EIA consultancy assignments.

timeline.title: First Pelagic Stock Survey
timeline.description: Completed the inaugural ordinary scientific survey of small pelagic fish abundance along the west and south shelves to inform sustainable quotas.

timeline.title: 43rd Anniversary Celebrated
timeline.description: Marked decades of leadership in aquatic conservation, research, and national development.

timeline.title: Sri Lanka Navy Partnership
timeline.description: Signed MOU for collaborative operation of research vessels, amplifying EEZ monitoring and Blue Economy innovation.

history.title: Emblem History
body: Established in 1981, NARA's emblem has remained a constant symbol of scientific integrity and marine stewardship.

The design reflects our evolution from a nascent research institution to a world-class centre for aquatic research excellence, guiding our mission to protect and sustainably manage Sri Lanka's precious marine and aquatic resources for future generations.

achievements.title: Spotlight on Achievements: Driving Impact Through Science
achievements.intro: Our milestones are more than dates--they represent tangible wins for sustainability, prosperity, and shared stewardship.

items.title: Scientific Excellence
items.description: Thousands of studies over four decades, from acoustic fish stock surveys to seagrass mapping in Palk Bay, with national honors such as the 2020 President's Awards for cutting-edge publications.

items.title: Global Partnerships
items.description: Collaborations with IUCN, the UK's Ocean Country Partnership Programme, and Norway's Nor-Lanka Blue Project have expanded youth training, coral conservation, and advanced trawl surveys.

items.title: Policy & Community Influence
items.description: Advisory services shaping national fisheries plans, shark conservation strategies, and lagoon water quality standards--protecting over 519,800 sq km while empowering coastal livelihoods.

items.title: Innovation in Action
items.description: Initiatives spanning shrimp disease surveillance, carbon sequestration assessments in Negombo mangroves, and eco-friendly livelihood programs that mitigate climate threats.
